executive_summary: Industrial supplies wholesalers sell a range of general-use supplies, including boxes and crates, packaging material, adhesives, abrasives, ropes, industrial hoses, valves and power transmission supplies. A range of customers, from auto mechanics to teams repairing and maintaining industrial facilities, use industrial supplies and turn to wholesalers to purchase these supplies. The downstream market also includes consumer beverage producers that purchase bottles and containers from the industry. In 2020, the volatile economic conditions during the pandemic hindered industry performance. The ensuing economic recovery supercharged demand for industrial supplies, supporting strong industry expansion. Industrial supplies wholesaling revenue is forecast to increase at a CAGR of 2.7% to $111.7 billion through the end of 2024, with growth of 0.5% estimated for the current year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High Interest Rates Have Only Slightly Slowed Industrial Output
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Fluctuations in the value of the US dollar, which affect the export performance of the wholesalers' key manufacturing markets, also indirectly influence industrial supplies wholesaling. The value of the US dollar has trended upward, inducing an increase in imported substitutes. Following a speedbump in production during the pandemic, the industry underwent a resurgence due to increased industrial production output and renewed demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: WHOLESALERS STRUGGLE TO FIND THEIR FOOTING DESPITE RISING CORPORATE PROFIT
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industrial supplies wholesaling performance is tied to overall macroeconomic conditions, as participants sell various general-use products for manufacturing and repair, depending on demand from various sectors. Slow manufacturing growth amid the pandemic has tempered revenue growth. A recovery in 2021 amid improving macroeconomic conditions boosted the industry, as industrial production and corporate profit surged. Gains in 2021 were primarily offset by subsequent demand declines from primary metal manufacturers along with skyrocketing interest rates that dissuaded industry investment, damaging revenue. The adverse effects of waning corporate profit are further exacerbated by an appreciating dollar blighting demand for domestic products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: WANING PROFIT SHIFTS THE INDUSTRY LANDSCAPE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Large wholesalers have sustained higher profit than the average company by integrating backward into upstream manufacturing operations, purchasing and distributing custom-made products. The pandemic significantly hindered industrial supplies wholesaler profit, as business disruptions and depleted demand crippled companies. To combat this, large enterprises have turned to source inputs globally, minimizing expenses and bolstering their profit.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE PANDEMIC-RELATED ECONOMIC DOWNTURN SIGNIFICANTLY HINDERED INDUSTRIAL SUPPLIES WHOLESALING
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, the industrial production index plummeted as many companies were forced to limit operations. While this reduced demand for industrial supplies, the industry was supported by companies demanding supplies and equipment needed to manufacture ventilators and other medical equipment. Many hospitals experienced a shortage of ventilators, so some manufacturers temporarily converted their facilities to produce these medical devices. To do this, these manufacturers needed parts from industrial supplies wholesalers, this demand helped shield the industry from suffering the full brunt of the economic downturn in 2020.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: FOREIGN COMPETITION WANES AS THE US DOLLAR DEPRECIATES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industrial supplies wholesalers rely heavily on demand from downstream manufacturers, which constitute its primary market. As the Manufacturing sector (IBISWorld report 31-33) begins to grow following a recovery from the effects of the pandemic, industrial supplies wholesalers will experience a correlated growth in parallel.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A Reinvigorated Manufacturing Sector Drives Industry Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growing demand from the Manufacturing sector will support industrial supplies wholesaling growth. As companies continue to invest in US production, demand for industrial supplies will be amplified. While demand from primary metal manufacturing will shrink, limited competition from imports will enable companies to grow and take advantage of US manufacturing demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit Stabilizes as Wholesalers Find New Ways to Limit Expenses
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Significant profit growth is unlikely as the wholesaling process does not justify large profit since its value added is small, especially compared with value added during the manufacturing process. Profit will be pressured by increasing employment and wages, given the industry's steady reliance on labor for sales, transportation and client services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Companies Gain Relief From Volatile Input Prices
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Previously, volatile shifts in the prices of key inputs, notably steel and fuel, plagued wholesalers as dramatic spikes caused companies to incur heavy costs. As fluctuating costs cannot be passed downstream, they inevitably cut into profit. Thankfully, a significant regression in steel prices will come as a relief to wholesalers.

industry_definition: This industry wholesales general-use supplies for manufacturing and warehousing industries. Supplies include abrasives, barrels, boxes and crates, industrial containers, industrial diamonds, packaging material, printing ink, power transmission supplies, mechanical rubber goods, ropes, valves and welding supplies. The industry strictly distributes general-use industrial supplies; for example, it provides the automotive sector with valves but not with tires.
key_trends: Industrial supplies wholesalers endure intense internal competition due to a highly saturated market. The necessity of being in close proximity to key downstream markets prevents wholesalers from being susceptible to competition from companies within another region.

Wholesale bypass has threatened the industry as manufacturers have begun to take advantage of economies of scale to sell directly to retailers. This process has effectively reduced the need for wholesalers and siphoned demand away from retail markets.

A recovery in industrial production has buoyed wholesalers following pandemic-related disruptions. Inclines in the industrial production index are not potent enough to offset the effect of penetration from low-cost substitutes.

Soaring interest rates and regressing corporate profit have eroded demand for industrial supplies wholesaling. High interest rates have sapped industry investment preventing wholesalers from capitalizing on improving macroeconomic conditions after the pandemic.

Despite having the highest market share, Genuine Parts still faces significant competition from other wholesalers including those that sell vehicle replacement parts for those built by the company itself. Genuine Parts has looked to differentiate itself and foster a stellar reputation among the industry through its commitment to ESG strategies.

MSC Industrial has further invested in its market-leading metalworking business by adding to its metalworking specialist team, introducing value-added services to its customers and expanding its vending programs. The company has increased focus on critical structural cost reductions in order to improve return on invested capital. It acquired a majority ownership interest in Hurst to break into the aerospace sector.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Industrial businesses that purchase supplies as inputs for their production processes constitute the most significant downstream market. Products demanded from this market include abrasives, inks, rubber goods and various inputs.

Other wholesalers turn to companies in this industry when sourcing items or restocking inventory. Some wholesalers seek to specialize in a particular brand or product and position themselves as the sole supplier for downstream industries in their geographic market.

Independent businesses demand this industry's products as operational inputs into their ongoing production processes. Valves and fittings for process equipment, bearings, bushings and other mechanical power transmission supplies are necessary components that keep assembly lines moving.

Retailers often represent the last stop on the supply chain for goods distributed by this industry. Retailers take advantage of the cost savings wholesalers achieve through bulk purchases, enabling retailers to increase product prices and profit from sales to end consumers.

All other customers include repair shops, governments, food service, farmers, households and various markets. The government has grown to account for an increasingly large portion of the market as reignited investment activity in domestic infrastructure and manufacturing have created a surge of demand for industrial supplies.

Contractors include building, heavy construction and special trade contractors and their demand for industrial supplies generates a negligible amount of revenue, minimized by decaying construction values.

products_and_services.product_description: Mechanical power transmission supplies include bearings and bushings, structural parts that support weight and bear friction between rotating parts. Mechanical power transmissions also include pneumatic systems that use gas to transmit power.
The distribution of industrial containers include cargo containers, shipping containers, storage for cargo transport, packaging and labeling supplies and consumer items like boxes, bottles and cans.

Abrasives, which polish and clean hard surfaces by rubbing or grinding, include loose, bonded, coated and super abrasive tools for downstream manufacturing, aerospace, telecommunications, and construction. An important subsegment of abrasives is industrial diamonds, which are diamonds that do not meet gem-quality standards, and used as an abrasive. Strapping and tape are used to fasten industrial parts together and are critical to a variety of manufacturing operations.

Industrial valves include angle valves, automatic valves, ball valves, boiler-gauge cocks, butterfly valves, gas cylinder valves, fire hydrant valves, gas valves, globe valves, pressure-control valves, safety valves and solenoid valves.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Iron and Steel Pipes and Tubing
products_and_services.product_description: A less substantial product subsegment includes fabricated steel boxes, steel shipping barrels and drums and all other metal containers.

Other industrial supplies include mechanical rubber goods, printing and duplicating inks, office stationery, welding gases, general-purpose industrial machinery, equipment, and other industrial supplies.

tier_1_suppliers: Boiler & Heat Exchanger Manufacturing in the US
Engine & Turbine Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wind Turbine Manufacturing in the US
Power Tools & Other General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Cardboard Box & Container Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Car & Automobile Manufacturing in the US
Mining, Oil & Gas Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Truck & Bus Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The industrial production index indicates the level of output from the mining, manufacturing, electric and gas industries. As the level of industrial production increases, so too will demand for general-use supplies, including containers, industrial hoses, power transmission equipment and valves. An increase in the industrial production index supports revenue growth for supplies wholesalers.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is home to multiple important downstream markets, like seafood canning in the Gulf of Mexico, bottling plants in Georgia, distilleries in Kentucky and Tennessee and mining throughout Appalachia. Florida leads the Southeast in number of establishments. Manufacturing activity, food processing and ports of trade make Florida a viable market for many industrial supplies wholesalers.

Major automotive manufacturers, which this industry supplies, are in the Great Lakes region. The Great Lakes produces more than 40.0% of steel and fabricated steel products, which are readily available for industry operators who consume such supplies on a large scale. Major Illinois-based industrial items manufacturers produce construction machinery, farm equipment, cellular phones, electrical housewares, commercial printers, metal coatings, appliances, containers, various industrial machinery and cooking products. Since 1988, Ohio has been a leading US manufacturing state, among the nation's leaders in machine-tool manufacturing, steel production, oil refining and automobile production. Wholesalers are concentrated in areas that have historically supported extensive manufacturing activity.

California is the nation's leading industrial state, ranking first in almost every measure of manufacturing activity, including number of establishments and employees, total payroll, value added by the manufacturer, value of shipments and new capital spending. California ranks among the leaders in machinery, fabricated metals, agricultural products, food processing, computers and aerospace technology. The West is a central food-processing region, with California being home to the most significant number of related establishments. This state is famous for the food industry because processors are close to fruits and vegetables throughout California, Mexico and Central America. A significant number of producers are also in Washington State, Oregon and Hawaii for the same reason. Manufacturing establishments locate near raw materials and, to a lesser extent, near product wholesalers and export markets. California's concentration partly relates to seaports that are ideal for export to Asia.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Wholesalers that only sell to other businesses for resale require a wholesaler's license from the US Department of Revenue. A retail tax license enables companies to sell both wholesale and retail. Wholesalers are subject to various nonenvironmental matters like occupational health and safety, wage restrictions, overtime and other employment matters related to state and federal governments.

Product standards fall into three categories: Communication standards that define the basic product terms in text and symbols, Design standards that establish dimensions, tolerances or other physical characteristics of products, Performance standards that provide a voluntary method of rating products.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, increasing barriers to entry.
Low and steady industry assistance level.
Low capital intensity level decreases barriers.

basis_points.basis_description: Industrial supplies wholesalers endure intense internal competition due to a highly saturated market.
The necessity of being in close proximity to key downstream markets prevents wholesalers from being susceptible to competition from companies within another region.
Wholesale bypass has threatened the industry, as manufacturers have begun to take advantage of economies of scale to sell directly to retailers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The hyper-localized nature of wholesaling leads to industry fragmentation.
Small-scale companies stay afloat by serving localized markets.
Industry concentration has increased slightly due to a combination of smaller companies' exits and consolidation through more prominent wholesalers' mergers and acquisitions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Industrial Supplies Wholesalers Incur Added Purchase Costs as Volatile Input Prices Swing Upward
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Like other wholesalers, the industry's most significant expense is purchase. The industry mainly purchases the supplies it wholesales and other service-related equipment like vehicles.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Demand for Skilled Labor Drives Wages
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wholesaling industries rely on labor for various operations, including the purchase of stock and its transport to downstream industries. companies have invested in highly skilled employees to operate machinery and handle more advanced equipment.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Already Low Profit Receives Added Pressure from High Input Prices
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wholesaling is a low value-added process and therefore does not produce high profit margins. Larger wholesalers absorb fixed costs through greater economies of scale and scope and may experience higher profit. For example, these prominent companies may be vertically integrated with the transportation sector, cutting fuel purchase costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Backward integration of some major companies in this industry enables them to operate at even lower unit costs. Some entrants may lack the vertical integration necessary to compete with these large incumbents effectively.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Trade-Weighted Index Changes Lead to Heavy Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry exhibits high revenue volatility. Volatility or the extent of annual revenue change reflects the industry's sensitivity to key downstream sectors, especially manufacturing and other industrial production sectors. Although industrial production has predominantly increased, boosting demand for industrial supplies, industry revenue gains have varied yearly.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Industry Performance Sways Along With Interest Rate Changes
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fluctuations in interest rates have caused downstream investment shifts that have both supported and limited demand growth. Most significantly, in 2020, revenue fell as the pandemic disrupted industrial production levels, leading to significantly lower demand for industrial supplies.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: VALVES REPURPOSED TO MEET CHANGING NEEDS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry wholesales a wide variety of industrial valves, however, demand for these specific products waned during the pandemic as business operations and industrial production was limited or entirely shutdown. In response to the onset of the pandemic, many hospitals experienced a shortage of ventilators, so some manufacturers temporarily converted their facilities to produce these medical devices. Wholesalers adapted to meet this rising demand for new valves.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: GROWING E-COMMERCE POPULARITY DRIVES INDUSTRY INNOVATION
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online services that enable customers to search inventory lists, check pricing, place and print orders and access online billing, have improved accessibility, reliability and efficiency. Warehousing technologies like radio-frequency identification, barcode scanning, automated inventory pulling and delivery logistics software optimized workflow and reduced labor requirements.

FAQs.question: What licenses are required for wholesalers in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers that only sell to other businesses for resale require a wholesaler's license from the US Department of Revenue. A retail tax license enables companies to sell both wholesale and retail.

FAQs.question: What are the different types of product standards in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Product standards fall into three categories: communication standards that define the basic product terms in text and symbols, design standards that establish dimensions, tolerances or other physical characteristics of products, and performance standards that provide a voluntary method of rating products.

FAQs.question: Does this industry receive any private sector support?
FAQs.answer: The Industrial Supplies Wholesaling industry doesn't receive any private sector support.

FAQs.question: How do companies in this industry remain competitive as demand declines?
FAQs.answer: Most wholesalers compete by trying to offer more efficient distribution.

FAQs.question: Are sales heavily dependent on any particular market or customer?
FAQs.answer: Some wholesalers specialize in only a few types of products and therefore cater to a single market.

FAQs.question: How does company size affect profitability and growth potential?
FAQs.answer: Large wholesalers are able to operate in more extensive distribution networks.

FAQs.question: Have companies explored growth through mergers or acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: Consolidation has been on the rise in this industry as large wholesalers look to acquire small distributors.

FAQs.question: How have companies implemented technology to improve purchasing efficiency?
FAQs.answer: Inventory management systems have helped many wholesalers better manage their products and sales.

FAQs.question: Do companies have e-commerce platforms for volume sales?
FAQs.answer: Online sales allow wholesalers to reduce their wage costs and grow their profit.

FAQs.question: How have safety regulations affected day-to-day operations?
FAQs.answer: Wholesalers must ensure that all products are up to safety standards, as these products are used by dangerous industries.

FAQs.question: What is the company policy on hazardous material handling?
FAQs.answer: Most states regulate the distribution of certain products, placing the burden of compliance on wholesalers.

FAQs.question: What steps have companies taken to boost profit?
FAQs.answer: Many wholesalers use inventory management systems and digital sales systems, reducing operating costs.

FAQs.question: How do fluctuations in the US dollar impact profitability?
FAQs.answer: As the dollar appreciates, imports increase, creating competition for wholesalers.

FAQs.question: Have companies offered incentives to keep large clients during economic downturns?
FAQs.answer: Loyal customers make repeat purchases. Establishing loyalty requires superior customer service, value-added products and competitive pricing.

FAQs.question: How do companies ensure staff knowledge about products?
FAQs.answer: Sales people should have a good working knowledge of their company's products from training, development courses or work in a related field.

FAQs.question: How important are supplier relationships in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Links to a diverse range of suppliers provide operators with a wide product range and greater target market.

FAQs.question: How have fluctuations in the US dollar value affected demand?
FAQs.answer: Although the industry does not engage in trade, its key industrial markets do. Therefore, a low trade-weighted index that boosts the export performance of downstream manufacturers also boosts demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: Do companies monitor changes in interest rates?
FAQs.answer: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note roughly reflects the level of interest rates in the economy.

FAQs.question: How much revenue is derived from the manufacturing sector?
FAQs.answer: Demand from primary metal manufacturing is a key driver of revenue for this industry.
